Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Good evening from Arizona State University in Tempe, Arizona. I’m Bob Schieffer of CBS News. I want to welcome you to the third and last of the 2004 debates between President George Bush and Senator John Kerry.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: As Jim Lehrer told you before the first one, these debates are sponsored by the Commission on Presidential Debates.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Tonight the topic will be domestic affairs, but the format will be the same as that first debate. I’ll moderate our discussion under detailed rules agreed to by the candidates, but the questions and the areas to be covered were chosen by me. I have not told the candidates or anyone else what they are.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: To refresh your memory on the rules, I will ask a question. The candidate is allowed two minutes to answer. His opponent then has a minute and a half to offer a rebuttal.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: At my discretion, I can extend the discussion by offering each candidate an additional 30 seconds.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: A green light will come on to signal the candidate has 30 seconds left. A yellow light signals 15 seconds left. A red light means five seconds left.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: There is also a buzzer, if it is needed.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: The candidates may not question each other directly. There are no opening statements, but there will be two-minute closing statements.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: There is an audience here tonight, but they have agreed to remain silent, except for right now, when they join me in welcoming President George Bush and Senator John Kerry.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Gentlemen, welcome to you both.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: By coin toss, the first question goes to Senator Kerry.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Senator, I want to set the stage for this discussion by asking the question that I think hangs over all of our politics today and is probably on the minds of many people watching this debate tonight.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: And that is, will our children and grandchildren ever live in a world as safe and secure as the world in which we grew up?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Well, first of all, Bob, thank you for moderating tonight.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Thank you, Arizona State, for welcoming us.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: And thank you to the Presidential Commission for undertaking this enormous task. We’re proud to be here.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Mr. President, I’m glad to be here with you again to share similarities and differences with the American people.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Will we ever be safe and secure again? Yes. We absolutely must be. That’s the goal.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Now, how do we achieve it is the most critical component of it.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I believe that this president, regrettably, rushed us into a war, made decisions about foreign policy, pushed alliances away. And, as a result, America is now bearing this extraordinary burden where we are not as safe as we ought to be.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: The measurement is not - Are we safer? The measurement is - Are we as safe as we ought to be? And there are a host of options that this president had available to him, like making sure that at all our ports in America containers are inspected. Only 95 percent of them — 95 percent come in today uninspected. That’s not good enough.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: People who fly on airplanes today, the cargo hold is not X-rayed, but the baggage is. That’s not good enough. Firehouses don’t have enough firefighters in them. Police officers are being cut from the streets of America because the president decided to cut the COPS program.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: So we can do a better job of homeland security. I can do a better job of waging a smarter, more effective war on terror and guarantee that we will go after the terrorists.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I will hunt them down, and we’ll kill them, we’ll capture them. We’ll do whatever is necessary to be safe.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But I pledge this to you, America - I will do it in the way that Franklin Roosevelt and Ronald Reagan and John Kennedy and others did, where we build the strongest alliances, where the world joins together, where we have the best intelligence and where we are able, ultimately, to be more safe and secure.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Mr. President, you have 90 seconds.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Bob, thank you very much.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I want to thank Arizona State as well.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Yes, we can be safe and secure, if we stay on the offense against the terrorists and if we spread freedom and liberty around the world.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I have got a comprehensive strategy to not only chase down the Al Qaida, wherever it exists — and we’re making progress; three-quarters of Al Qaida leaders have been brought to justice — but to make sure that countries that harbor terrorists are held to account.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: As a result of securing ourselves and ridding the Taliban out of Afghanistan, the Afghan people had elections this weekend. And the first voter was a 19-year-old woman. Think about that. Freedom is on the march.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: We held to account a terrorist regime in Saddam Hussein.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: In other words, in order to make sure we’re secure, there must be a comprehensive plan. My opponent just this weekend talked about how terrorism could be reduced to a nuisance, comparing it to prostitution, illegal gambling. I think that attitude and that point of view is dangerous. I don’t think you can secure America for the long run if you don’t have a comprehensive view as to how to defeat these people.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: At home, we’ll do everything we can to protect the homeland. I signed the homeland security bill to better align our assets and resources. My opponent voted against it.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: We’re doing everything we can to protect our borders and ports.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: But absolutely we can be secure in the long run. It just takes good, strong leadership.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Anything to add, Senator Kerry?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Yes. When the president had an opportunity to capture or kill Osama bin Laden, he took his focus off of them, outsourced the job to Afghan warlords, and Osama bin Laden escaped.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Six months after he said Osama bin Laden must be caught dead or alive, this president was asked, “Where is Osama bin Laden? ” He said, “I don’t know. I don’t really think about him very much. I’m not that concerned. “

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: We need a president who stays deadly focused on the real war on terror.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Mr. President?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Gosh, I just don’t think I ever said I’m not worried about Osama bin Laden. It’s kind of one of those exaggerations.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Of course we’re worried about Osama bin Laden. We’re on the hunt after Osama bin Laden. We’re using every asset at our disposal to get Osama bin Laden.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: My opponent said this war is a matter of intelligence and law enforcement. No, this war is a matter of using every asset at our disposal to keep the American people protected.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: New question, Mr. President, to you.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: We are talking about protecting ourselves from the unexpected, but the flu season is suddenly upon us. Flu kills thousands of people every year.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Suddenly we find ourselves with a severe shortage of flu vaccine. How did that happen?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Bob, we relied upon a company out of England to provide about half of the flu vaccines for the United States citizen, and it turned out that the vaccine they were producing was contaminated. And so we took the right action and didn’t allow contaminated medicine into our country. We’re working with Canada to hopefully — that they’ll produce a — help us realize the vaccine necessary to make sure our citizens have got flu vaccinations during this upcoming season.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: My call to our fellow Americans is if you’re healthy, if you’re younger, don’t get a flu shot this year. Help us prioritize those who need to get the flu shot, the elderly and the young.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: The CDC, responsible for health in the United States, is setting those priorities and is allocating the flu vaccine accordingly.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I haven’t gotten a flu shot, and I don’t intend to because I want to make sure those who are most vulnerable get treated.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: We have a problem with litigation in the United States of America. Vaccine manufacturers are worried about getting sued, and therefore they have backed off from providing this kind of vaccine.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: One of the reasons I’m such a strong believer in legal reform is so that people aren’t afraid of producing a product that is necessary for the health of our citizens and then end up getting sued in a court of law.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: But the best thing we can do now, Bob, given the circumstances with the company in England is for those of us who are younger and healthy, don’t get a flu shot.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Senator Kerry?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: This really underscores the problem with the American health-care system. It’s not working for the American family. And it’s gotten worse under President Bush over the course of the last years.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Five million Americans have lost their health insurance in this country. You’ve got about a million right here in Arizona, just shy, 950,000, who have no health insurance at all. 82,000 Arizonians lost their health insurance under President Bush’s watch. 223,000 kids in Arizona have no health insurance at all.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: All across our country — go to Ohio, 1. 4 million Ohioans have no health insurance, 114,000 of them lost it under President Bush; Wisconsin, 82,000 Wisconsinites lost it under President Bush.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: This president has turned his back on the wellness of America. And there is no system. In fact, it’s starting to fall apart not because of lawsuits — though they are a problem, and John Edwards and I are committed to fixing them — but because of the larger issue that we don’t cover Americans.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Children across our country don’t have health care. We’re the richest country on the face of the planet, the only industrialized nation in the world not to do it.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I have a plan to cover all Americans. We’re going to make it affordable and accessible. We’re going to let everybody buy into the same health-care plan senators and congressmen give themselves.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Mr. President, would you like to add something?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I would. Thank you.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I want to remind people listening tonight that a plan is not a litany of complaints, and a plan is not to lay out programs that you can’t pay for.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: He just said he wants everybody to be able to buy in to the same plan that senators and congressmen get. That costs the government $7,700 per family. If every family in America signed up, like the senator suggested, if would cost us $5 trillion over 10 years.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: It’s an empty promise. It’s called bait and switch.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Time’s up.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Thank you.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Actually, it’s not an empty promise.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: It’s really interesting, because the president used that very plan as a reason for seniors to accept his prescription drug plan. He said, if it’s good enough for the congressmen and senators to have choice, seniors ought to have choice.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: What we do is we have choice. I choose Blue Cross/Blue Shield. Other senators, other congressmen choose other programs.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But the fact is, we’re going to help Americans be able to buy into it. Those that can afford it are going to buy in themselves. We’re not giving this away for nothing.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: All right.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Senator Kerry, a new question. Let’s talk about economic security. You pledged during the last debate that you would not raise taxes on those making less than $200,000 a year. But the price of everything is going up, and we all know it. Health-care costs, as you are talking about, is skyrocketing, the cost of the war.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: My question is, how can you or any president, whoever is elected next time, keep that pledge without running this country deeper into debt and passing on more of the bills that we’re running up to our children?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I’ll tell you exactly how I can do it: by reinstating what President Bush took away, which is called pay as you go.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: During the 1990s, we had pay-as-you-go rules. If you were going to pass something in the Congress, you had to show where you are going to pay for it and how.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: President Bush has taken — he’s the only president in history to do this. He’s also the only president in 72 years to lose jobs — 1. 6 million jobs lost. He’s the only president to have incomes of families go down for the last three years; the only president to see exports go down; the only president to see the lowest level of business investment in our country as it is today.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Now, I’m going to reverse that. I’m going to change that. We’re going to restore the fiscal discipline we had in the 1990s.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Every plan that I have laid out — my health-care plan, my plan for education, my plan for kids to be able to get better college loans — I’ve shown exactly how I’m going to pay for those.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: And we start — we don’t do it exclusively — but we start by rolling back George Bush’s unaffordable tax cut for the wealthiest people, people earning more than $200,000 a year, and we pass, hopefully, the McCain-Kerry Commission which identified some $60 billion that we can get.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: We shut the loophole which has American workers actually subsidizing the loss of their own job. They just passed an expansion of that loophole in the last few days - $43 billion of giveaways, including favors to the oil and gas industry and the people importing ceiling fans from China.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I’m going to stand up and fight for the American worker. And I am going to do it in a way that’s fiscally sound. I show how I pay for the health care, how we pay for the education.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I have a manufacturing jobs credit. We pay for it by shutting that loophole overseas. We raise the student loans. I pay for it by changing the relationship with the banks.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: This president has never once vetoed one bill; the first president in a hundred years not to do that.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Mr. President?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Well, his rhetoric doesn’t match his record.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: He been a senator for 20 years. He voted to increase taxes 98 times. When they tried to reduce taxes, he voted against that 127 times. He talks about being a fiscal conservative, or fiscally sound, but he voted over — he voted 277 times to waive the budget caps, which would have cost the taxpayers $4. 2 trillion.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: He talks about PAYGO. I’ll tell you what PAYGO means, when you’re a senator from Massachusetts, when you’re a colleague of Ted Kennedy, pay go means: You pay, and he goes ahead and spends.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: He’s proposed $2. 2 trillion of new spending, and yet the so-called tax on the rich, which is also a tax on many small-business owners in America, raises $600 million by our account — billion, $800 billion by his account.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: There is a tax gap. And guess who usually ends up filling the tax gap? The middle class.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I propose a detailed budget, Bob. I sent up my budget man to the Congress, and he says, here’s how we’re going to reduce the deficit in half by five years. It requires pro-growth policies that grow our economy and fiscal sanity in the halls of Congress.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Let’s go to a new question, Mr. President. Two minutes. And let’s continue on jobs.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: You know, there are all kind of statistics out there, but I want to bring it down to an individual.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Mr. President, what do you say to someone in this country who has lost his job to someone overseas who’s being paid a fraction of what that job paid here in the United States?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I’d say, Bob, I’ve got policies to continue to grow our economy and create the jobs of the 21st century. And here’s some help for you to go get an education. Here’s some help for you to go to a community college.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: We’ve expanded trade adjustment assistance. We want to help pay for you to gain the skills necessary to fill the jobs of the 21st century.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: You know, there’s a lot of talk about how to keep the economy growing. We talk about fiscal matters. But perhaps the best way to keep jobs here in America and to keep this economy growing is to make sure our education system works.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I went to Washington to solve problems. And I saw a problem in the public education system in America. They were just shuffling too many kids through the system, year after year, grade after grade, without learning the basics.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And so we said - Let’s raise the standards. We’re spending more money, but let’s raise the standards and measure early and solve problems now, before it’s too late.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: No, education is how to help the person who’s lost a job. Education is how to make sure we’ve got a workforce that’s productive and competitive.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Got four more years, I’ve got more to do to continue to raise standards, to continue to reward teachers and school districts that are working, to emphasize math and science in the classrooms, to continue to expand Pell Grants to make sure that people have an opportunity to start their career with a college diploma.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And so the person you talked to, I say, here’s some help, here’s some trade adjustment assistance money for you to go a community college in your neighborhood, a community college which is providing the skills necessary to fill the jobs of the 21st century. And that’s what I would say to that person.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Senator Kerry?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I want you to notice how the president switched away from jobs and started talking about education principally.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Let me come back in one moment to that, but I want to speak for a second, if I can, to what the president said about fiscal responsibility.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Being lectured by the president on fiscal responsibility is a little bit like Tony Soprano talking to me about law and order in this country.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: This president has taken a $5. 6 trillion surplus and turned it into deficits as far as the eye can see. Health-care costs for the average American have gone up 64 percent; tuitions have gone up 35 percent; gasoline prices up 30 percent; Medicare premiums went up 17 percent a few days ago; prescription drugs are up 12 percent a year.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But guess what, America? The wages of Americans have gone down. The jobs that are being created in Arizona right now are paying about $13,700 less than the jobs that we’re losing.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: And the president just walks on by this problem. The fact is that he’s cut job-training money. $1 billion was cut. They only added a little bit back this year because it’s an election year.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: They’ve cut the Pell Grants and the Perkins loans to help kids be able to go to college.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: They’ve cut the training money. They’ve wound up not even extending unemployment benefits and not even extending health care to those people who are unemployed.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I’m going to do those things, because that’s what’s right in America: Help workers to transition in every respect.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: New question to you, Senator Kerry, two minutes. And it’s still on jobs. You know, many experts say that a president really doesn’t have much control over jobs. For example, if someone invents a machine that does the work of five people, that’s progress. That’s not the president’s fault.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: So I ask you, is it fair to blame the administration entirely for this loss of jobs?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I don’t blame them entirely for it. I blame the president for the things the president could do that has an impact on it.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Outsourcing is going to happen. I’ve acknowledged that in union halls across the country. I’ve had shop stewards stand up and say, “Will you promise me you’re going to stop all this outsourcing? “And I’ve looked them in the eye and I’ve said, “No, I can’t do that. “

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: What I can promise you is that I will make the playing field as fair as possible, that I will, for instance, make certain that with respect to the tax system that you as a worker in America are not subsidizing the loss of your job.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Today, if you’re an American business, you actually get a benefit for going overseas. You get to defer your taxes.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: So if you’re looking at a competitive world, you say to yourself, “Hey, I do better overseas than I do here in America. “

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: That’s not smart. I don’t want American workers subsidizing the loss of their own job. And when I’m president, we’re going to shut that loophole in a nanosecond and we’re going to use that money to lower corporate tax rates in America for all corporations, 5 percent. And we’re going to have a manufacturing jobs credit and a job hiring credit so we actually help people be able to hire here.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: The second thing that we can do is provide a fair trade playing field. This president didn’t stand up for Boeing when Airbus was violating international rules and subsidies. He discovered Boeing during the course of this campaign after I’d been talking about it for months.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: The fact is that the president had an opportunity to stand up and take on China for currency manipulation. There are companies that wanted to petition the administration. They were told - Don’t even bother; we’re not going to listen to it.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: The fact is that there have been markets shut to us that we haven’t stood up and fought for. I’m going to fight for a fair trade playing field for the American worker. And I will fight for the American worker just as hard as I fight for my own job. That’s what the American worker wants. And if we do that, we can have an impact.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Plus, we need fiscal discipline. Restore fiscal discipline, we’ll do a lot better.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Mr. President?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Whew!

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Let me start with the Pell Grants. In his last litany of misstatements. He said we cut Pell Grants. We’ve increased Pell Grants by a million students. That’s a fact.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: You know, he talks to the workers. Let me talk to the workers.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: You’ve got more money in your pocket as a result of the tax relief we passed and he opposed.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: If you have a child, you got a $1,000 child credit. That’s money in your pocket.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: If you’re married, we reduced the marriage penalty. The code ought to encourage marriage, not discourage marriage.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: We created a 10 percent bracket to help lower-income Americans. A family of four making $40,000 received about $1,700 in tax relief.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: It’s your money. The way my opponent talks, he said, “We’re going to spend the government’s money. “No, we’re spending your money. And when you have more money in your pocket, you’re able to better afford things you want.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I believe the role of government is to stand side by side with our citizens to help them realize their dreams, not tell citizens how to live their lives.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: My opponent talks about fiscal sanity. His record in the United States Senate does not match his rhetoric.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: He voted to increase taxes 98 times and to bust the budget 277 times.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Senator Kerry?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Bob, anybody can play with these votes. Everybody knows that.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I have supported or voted for tax cuts over 600 times. I broke with my party in order to balance the budget, and Ronald Reagan signed into law the tax cut that we voted for. I voted for IRA tax cuts. I voted for small-business tax cuts.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But you know why the Pell Grants have gone up in their numbers? Because more people qualify for them because they don’t have money.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But they’re not getting the $5,100 the president promised them. They’re getting less money.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: We have more people who qualify. That’s not what we want.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Senator, no one’s playing with your votes. You voted to increase taxes 98 times. When they voted — when they proposed reducing taxes, you voted against it 126 times.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: He voted to violate the budget cap 277 times. You know, there’s a main stream in American politics and you sit right on the far left bank. As a matter of fact, your record is such that Ted Kennedy, your colleague, is the conservative senator from Massachusetts.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Mr. President, let’s get back to economic issues. But let’s shift to some other questions here.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Both of you are opposed to gay marriage. But to understand how you have come to that conclusion, I want to ask you a more basic question. Do you believe homosexuality is a choice?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: You know, Bob, I don’t know. I just don’t know. I do know that we have a choice to make in America and that is to treat people with tolerance and respect and dignity. It’s important that we do that.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And I also know in a free society people, consenting adults can live the way they want to live.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And that’s to be honored.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: But as we respect someone’s rights, and as we profess tolerance, we shouldn’t change — or have to change — our basic views on the sanctity of marriage. I believe in the sanctity of marriage. I think it’s very important that we protect marriage as an institution, between a man and a woman.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I proposed a constitutional amendment. The reason I did so was because I was worried that activist judges are actually defining the definition of marriage, and the surest way to protect marriage between a man and woman is to amend the Constitution.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: It has also the benefit of allowing citizens to participate in the process. After all, when you amend the Constitution, state legislatures must participate in the ratification of the Constitution.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I’m deeply concerned that judges are making those decisions and not the citizenry of the United States. You know, Congress passed a law called DOMA, the Defense of Marriage Act.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: My opponent was against it. It basically protected states from the action of one state to another. It also defined marriage as between a man and woman.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: But I’m concerned that that will get overturned. And if it gets overturned, then we’ll end up with marriage being defined by courts, and I don’t think that’s in our nation’s interests.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Senator Kerry?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: We’re all God’s children, Bob. And I think if you were to talk to Dick Cheney’s daughter, who is a lesbian, she would tell you that she’s being who she was, she’s being who she was born as.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I think if you talk to anybody, it’s not choice. I’ve met people who struggled with this for years, people who were in a marriage because they were living a sort of convention, and they struggled with it.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: And I’ve met wives who are supportive of their husbands or vice versa when they finally sort of broke out and allowed themselves to live who they were, who they felt God had made them.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I think we have to respect that.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: The president and I share the belief that marriage is between a man and a woman. I believe that. I believe marriage is between a man and a woman.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But I also believe that because we are the United States of America, we’re a country with a great, unbelievable Constitution, with rights that we afford people, that you can’t discriminate in the workplace. You can’t discriminate in the rights that you afford people.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: You can’t disallow someone the right to visit their partner in a hospital. You have to allow people to transfer property, which is why I’m for partnership rights and so forth.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Now, with respect to DOMA and the marriage laws, the states have always been able to manage those laws. And they’re proving today, every state, that they can manage them adequately.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Senator Kerry, a new question for you.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: The New York Times reports that some Catholic archbishops are telling their church members that it would be a sin to vote for a candidate like you because you support a woman’s right to choose an abortion and unlimited stem-cell research.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: What is your reaction to that?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I respect their views. I completely respect their views. I am a Catholic. And I grew up learning how to respect those views. But I disagree with them, as do many.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I believe that I can’t legislate or transfer to another American citizen my article of faith. What is an article of faith for me is not something that I can legislate on somebody who doesn’t share that article of faith.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I believe that choice is a woman’s choice. It’s between a woman, God and her doctor. And that’s why I support that.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Now, I will not allow somebody to come in and change Roe v. Wade.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: The president has never said whether or not he would do that. But we know from the people he’s tried to appoint to the court he wants to.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I will not. I will defend the right of Roe v. Wade.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Now, with respect to religion, you know, as I said, I grew up a Catholic. I was an altar boy. I know that throughout my life this has made a difference to me.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: And as President Kennedy said when he ran for president, he said, “I’m not running to be a Catholic president. I’m running to be a president who happens to be Catholic. “

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: My faith affects everything that I do, in truth. There’s a great passage of the Bible that says, “What does it mean, my brother, to say you have faith if there are no deeds? Faith without works is dead. “

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: And I think that everything you do in public life has to be guided by your faith, affected by your faith, but without transferring it in any official way to other people.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: That’s why I fight against poverty. That’s why I fight to clean up the environment and protect this earth.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: That’s why I fight for equality and justice. All of those things come out of that fundamental teaching and belief of faith.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But I know this, that President Kennedy in his inaugural address told all of us that here on Earth, God’s work must truly be our own. And that’s what we have to — I think that’s the test of public service.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Mr. President?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I think it’s important to promote a culture of life. I think a hospitable society is a society where every being counts and every person matters. I believe the ideal world is one in which every child is protected in law and welcomed to life. I understand there’s great differences on this issue of abortion, but I believe reasonable people can come together and put good law in place that will help reduce the number of abortions.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Take, for example, the ban on partial birth abortion. It’s a brutal practice. People from both political parties came together in the halls of Congress and voted overwhelmingly to ban that practice. It made a lot of sense. My opponent, in that he’s out of the mainstream, voted against that law.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: What I’m saying is, is that as we promote life and promote a culture of life, surely there are ways we can work together to reduce the number of abortions: continue to promote adoption laws — it’s a great alternative to abortion — continue to fund and promote maternity group homes; I will continue to promote abstinence programs.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: The last debate, my opponent said his wife was involved with those programs. That’s great. I appreciate that very much. All of us ought to be involved with programs that provide a viable alternative to abortion.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Mr. President, let’s have a new question. It goes to you. And let’s get back to economic issues.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Health insurance costs have risen over 36 percent over the last four years according to The Washington Post. We’re paying more. We’re getting less.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: I would like to ask you - Who bears responsibility for this? Is it the government? Is it the insurance companies? Is it the lawyers? Is it the doctors? Is it the administration?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Gosh, I sure hope it’s not the administration.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: There’s a — no, look, there’s a systemic problem. Health-care costs are on the rise because the consumers are not involved in the decision-making process. Most health-care costs are covered by third parties. And therefore, the actual user of health care is not the purchaser of health care. And there’s no market forces involved with health care.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: It’s one of the reasons I’m a strong believer in what they call health savings accounts. These are accounts that allow somebody to buy a low-premium, high-deductible catastrophic plan and couple it with tax-free savings. Businesses can contribute, employees can contribute on a contractual basis. But this is a way to make sure people are actually involved with the decision-making process on health care.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Secondly, I do believe the lawsuits — I don’t believe, I know — that the lawsuits are causing health-care costs to rise in America. That’s why I’m such a strong believer in medical liability reform.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: In the last debate, my opponent said those lawsuits only caused the cost to go up by 1 percent. Well, he didn’t include the defensive practice of medicine that costs the federal government some $28 billion a year and costs our society between $60 billion and $100 billion a year.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Thirdly, one of the reasons why there’s still high cost in medicine is because this is — they don’t use any information technology. It’s like if you looked at the — it’s the equivalent of the buggy and horse days, compared to other industries here in America.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And so, we’ve got to introduce high technology into health care. We’re beginning to do it. We’re changing the language. We want there to be electronic medical records to cut down on error, as well as reduce cost.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: People tell me that when the health-care field is fully integrated with information technology, it’ll wring some 20 percent of the cost out of the system.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And finally, moving generic drugs to the market quicker.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And so, those are four ways to help control the costs in health care.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Senator Kerry?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: The reason health-care costs are getting higher, one of the principal reasons is that this administration has stood in the way of common-sense efforts that would have reduced the costs. Let me give you a prime example.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: In the Senate we passed the right of Americans to import drugs from Canada. But the president and his friends took it out in the House, and now you don’t have that right. The president blocked you from the right to have less expensive drugs from Canada.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: We also wanted Medicare to be able to negotiate bulk purchasing. The VA does that. The VA provides lower-cost drugs to our veterans. We could have done that in Medicare.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Medicare is paid for by the American taxpayer. Medicare belongs to you. Medicare is for seniors, who many of them are on fixed income, to lift them out of poverty.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But rather than help you, the taxpayer, have lower cost, rather than help seniors have less expensive drugs, the president made it illegal — illegal — for Medicare to actually go out and bargain for lower prices.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Result - $139 billion windfall profit to the drug companies coming out of your pockets. That’s a large part of your 17 percent increase in Medicare premiums.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: When I’m president, I’m sending that back to Congress and we’re going to get a real prescription drug benefit.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Now, we also have people sicker because they don’t have health insurance. So whether it’s diabetes or cancer, they come to hospitals later and it costs America more.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: We got to have health care for all Americans.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Go ahead, Mr. President.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I think it’s important, since he talked about the Medicare plan, has he been in the United States Senate for 20 years? He has no record on reforming of health care. No record at all.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: He introduced some 300 bills and he’s passed five.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: No record of leadership.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I came to Washington to solve problems. I was deeply concerned about seniors having to choose between prescription drugs and food. And so I led. And in 2006, our seniors will get a prescription drug coverage in Medicare.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Senator Kerry? Thirty seconds.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Once again, the president is misleading America. I’ve actually passed 56 individual bills that I’ve personally written and, in addition to that, and not always under my name, there is amendments on certain bills.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But more importantly, with respect to the question of no record, I helped write — I did write, I was one of the original authors of the early childhood health care and the expansion of health care that we did in the middle of the 1990s. And I’m very proud of that.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: So the president’s wrong.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: Let me direct the next question to you, Senator Kerry, and again, let’s stay on health care.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: You have, as you have proposed and as the president has commented on tonight, proposed a massive plan to extend health-care coverage to children. You’re also talking about the government picking up a big part of the catastrophic bills that people get at the hospital.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: And you have said that you can pay for this by rolling back the president’s tax cut on the upper 2 percent.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: You heard the president say earlier tonight that it’s going to cost a whole lot more money than that.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: SCHIEFFER
Text: I’d just ask you, where are you going to get the money?

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Well, two leading national news networks have both said the president’s characterization of my health-care plan is incorrect. One called it fiction. The other called it untrue.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: The fact is that my health-care plan, America, is very simple. It gives you the choice. I don’t force you to do anything. It’s not a government plan. The government doesn’t require you to do anything. You choose your doctor. You choose your plan.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: If you don’t want to take the offer of the plan that I want to put forward, you don’t have do. You can keep what you have today, keep a high deductible, keep high premiums, keep a high co-pay, keep low benefits.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But I got a better plan. And I don’t think a lot of people are going to want to keep what they have today.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Here’s what I do: We take over Medicaid children from the states so that every child in America is covered. And in exchange, if the states want to — they’re not forced to, they can choose to — they cover individuals up to 300 percent of poverty. It’s their choice.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I think they’ll choose it, because it’s a net plus of $5 billion to them.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: We allow you — if you choose to, you don’t have to — but we give you broader competition to allow you to buy into the same health care plan that senators and congressmen give themselves. If it’s good enough for us, it’s good enough for every American. I believe that your health care is just as important as any politician in Washington, D. C.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: You want to buy into it, you can. We give you broader competition. That helps lower prices.

Title: October 13, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U. S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: In addition to that, we’re going to allow people 55 to 64 to buy into Medicare early.
